title.narrative: FOCUS Prevention, Prosecution & Partnerships: Human Trafficking & Abuse of the Vulnerable Northern Thailand 2016-2020

description.narrative: FOCUS/TRAFCORD develop systematic to prevent and protect human trafficking in Northern of Thailand. The effects of problem are manifested on the one hand by a proliferation of victims, many are women and children from vulnerable groups such as stateless, ethnic minority or migrant workers, who have been enslaved, abused and exploited for profit and on the other hand by individuals running human trafficking rackets. Project of PP&P:HT&AV aim to advocate for rights and provide protection for children, women and other vulnerable groups from 9 provinces in northern Thailand, including surrounding countries (Burma, Laos). The thematic areas focus combating Human Trafficking, Child Protection and empower women and girls Project objective to combat human trafficking and other forms of rights abuses Project expected result are act as a Coordination Centre to coordinate and strengthen networks of rights defenders, capacity of government and non-government agencies and community groups, vulnerable access and gain control of their own rights and take positive and constructive action against abuse and exploitation to ensure their rights are respected. Strategic activity, 1: Acting as Rights Defenders, advocating for rights and monitoring as watchdogs, and setting up a coordination center for provincial and cross border multidisciplinary teams (MDTs) and networks in Northern Thailand and across borders. 2: Build the capacity of government agencies, Duty Bearers, to respect, protect, promote and fulfil rights of vulnerable and high risk groups efficiently, transparently and without discrimination, 3: Empower Rights Holders, to claim their own rights and access services. Other stakeholder including Thai partner agencies, government and non-government, cooperate with TRAFCORD on an ongoing basis in operations to prevent and combat human trafficking.
This project mainly contributes to results within Empowerment of human rights defenders. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
